h3bOO9saJvcg_iJpwMi1nQ.text: Have tried The Oink Cafe three times in the past month with mixed success. I have zero complaints about the entrees. All three times it arrived hot and tasty. We got two of the bacon topped donuts to go because they looked amazing, but they were truly horrible. Took two bites and trashed the rest.  The hostess I had today seemed to be in a fowl mood. Ignored us when we first came in. She seemed more interested in whatever she was working on at the podium. Finally said a total of one word, "2?" Then we waited about 15 minutes before a waitress came around and it was not busy. She was sweet and helpful once she got to us. On my second visit the waitress seemed to have way too many tables or something. She did get our order in and was very pleasant but then we didn't see her again. The manager was there thankfully and stepped in and got our bill. I think Oink really needs to work on customer service. Not sure I'd go back.

c1QnNprN7IEiYXBlmc8Oug.text: Got seated relatively quickly, but it was downhill from there. Waited 40 minutes for mediocre food. Kitchen staff clearly did not know what they were doing. All the tables around us had at least as long a wait. Food was just not coming out.

4_LH0iVbQ2VJBlWOlraT1Q.text: So I don't write a bad review unless the situation absolutely demands such a resolution. Furthermore, although this bad review is mostly about the food, I've never written a bad review about someone's service, I figure that's generally the nature of the beast, until today...  Murphy's Law was swinging in full effect. Everything that could go wrong - did. First, the food. My mom and I both ordered a half Cobb salad for $8, the full was $10. But we didn't want a monster, just a good size salad to fill us up. What came out was what I can only compare to a side dinner salad - the tiny thing that restaurants serve to just tide you over until the actual meal comes. You've got to be kidding.   I'm allergic to tomatoes and absolutely hate blue cheese, so I subbed the blue cheese for cheddar and ordered no tomatoes because I was allergic. Of course, got tomatoes, atop my teeny tiny little salad. I gave those to my mom. I went to pour a little ranch on my salad, and it had the same consistency of water, which rolled right off both of my pieces of lettuce. I felt I had to order another ranch and try this again, from maybe an engineering perspective to make this work, the waiter brought me blue cheese.  I poured it on, realized it was chunky, and ruined the small half of my salad that was remaining.   It took 5 minutes to get my waiters attention so I could point out his mistake. I told him "you brought me blue cheese" as I suggested a gander down to the chunks on my lettuce. Awkward silence, he wasn't getting it. So I then said "I asked for another ranch...," to which he shrugged and said "Sooooo..... do you want another salad?"  Well buddy, you just ruined mine sooooo..... yeah.   Five minutes later, I get another salad, with tomatoes. He sets it down, walks away, and it was then I realized I had left my fork on my old plate. A few more minutes go buy as I attempt to get his attention to get another fork - this must be the most oblivious waiter I have ever seen. I just left it sitting there hoping someone would notice. It was then he brought our check, laid it on the table next to my new salad, with tomatoes, and no fork. I brought all this up again, now making my mom uncomfortable, and said just forget it, it's a perfect storm of events, let's cut this cord and I'll just go. He then proceeded to get another check with my salad off of it.   The hostess came by to get our plates and starts drilling me on why i hadn't touched my salad (the few pieces of lettuce were fine, it was literally everything else that was wrong and not to mention, I still don't have a fork... I really don't like confrontation at a restaurant though, I just don't want to talk about it anymore,) but she kept drilling me! And then started drilling me on the service! I told her "I don't want anymore confrontation, I'm just going to write a review on yelp." She rolled her eyes and kept drilling me, and I said it again, so she rolled her eyes and said "yeah I get it, you're just going to write a review on yelp. Whatever."  And I'm only mentioning this because it's hilarious to think they could get a soda wrong, but they didn't have their syrup/CO2 ratios right, so this whole time, my Coke tasted like gross soda water.   It took forever to get our salads, and I felt bad for the lady next to us at a table by herself in the middle of the restaurant who also sat and waited 20 minutes for service. You could obviously tell she was uncomfortable sitting there - in the middle of the floor, alone with everyone watching her. She looked miserable from this situation! They couldn't maybe seat her somewhere more comfortable or at least expedite her breakfast?!?! I couldn't be the only one who noticed, come on. Common sense isn't common.   You'd get more food and better service at a truck stop. If you want  lunch with a heaping side of 'pissed off' because of bad service, expensive and minimal food, and bad attitudes, this is your place.

2ZWp-dSxxxzWsvV1Z_un4A.text: We live right down the street so when we saw a new breakfast place coming in we were pretty excited.  We finally got the chance to try it this week and it was okay. Their food was fairly good... but definitely nothing out of the ordinary - like we won't be dying to come back anytime soon. I did have their jalapeno bacon though and that was very good!  We didn't have any service for the first 10 minutes we sat at our table, but as soon as we did service was great.  Pricing isn't the best. $8 for their signature Bloody Mary and it was nothing special at all.  Their decor is awful... neon green and brown! Huh?? But that has nothing to do with their food - Just the overall ambience we didn't care for.  All in all... it wasn't bad food just nothing special. We may come back someday if we are dying to eat out for breakfast and don't want to drive far.

PzmcthlpQFhK2LdEff-DFQ.text: I was hoping it was going to be a great experience although it ended up a disappointment.  The wait on a Sunday to be seated was not bad at all.  The wait to get food was another story.  It took over an hour to get our food from placing our order.  The unfortunate reality is we were not the only one.  People who were seated prior to us still did not get our food when we got ours.  We let the manager know and he got our food within two minutes of us letting him know and he comped our meal.  The food was less than warm.  Our server was sweet as ever and was incredibly apologetic for our experience.  I would be happy to give them a second chance.  I believe they can make these little corrections and keep their customers happy.  I look forward to the opportunity to have a better experience.

zvT4yh2lt_xB555t0vpwQw.text: I had such a wonderful experience at The Oink! First the service was superior. Taylor was knowledgeable, kind and didn't rush us. The Assistant GM is making sure everyone is pleased and he's working and helping the staff! They really care about the community! The food is worth the money. If you're looking for Denny's slop  or IHOP's fake over sweet, cheap and over processed foods. Then this isn't the place for you. If you're looking for high quality fruit, eggs, pork, veggies and protein. This is your place. Also their beverages are amazing. We ordered a couple flights of mimosas and bloody Mary's, great! But the kids ordered cranberry juice and they brought out a small carafes of juice! Two times! My only suggestion is the mimosas need to be chilled. I had to add Ice. If the juice,  Sparkling wine would have been chilled and then served chilled glasses that would have been the topping to the cake. The price is worth it and super good for the mimosa and bloody Mary's. Will be back again, worth the wait, price and the service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

YYSbLn0lBOg7pISU5cVPZQ.text: After months of wanting to go to the oink cafe for breakfast we finally went, the pictures on yelp and Instagram looked so good, we expected a delicious breakfast. Let's just say the pictures were deceiving  The waitress was horrible! And the food was not good I would of prefer to have mc Donald's for breakfast to be honest. The waitress kept forgetting our drinks, our food took forever to arrive and the place wasn't even that full, I asked for an iced coffee and I had to make it myself she only poured coffee and some ice cubes on my cup and told me to make it on my own.

6s3OVvgc1_ZACSxP1vuVXg.text: This is an all time favorite! The friendly staff and incredible food are the reason why we will always come back! The homemade biscuits are amazing, and we've never had a bad meal. The breakfast sandwich, omelets and eggs Benedict are always our go-to! If you're looking for a good drink try the verde Bloody Mary!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

oKLYuvS_FTWgGSNsoYPmzA.text: Food is priced fairly and is delicious. The reason I couldn't give it more stars is because the point of us going was that they boasted different cured bacon. We got a 1/2 flight of bacon and to us, it was very hard to distinguish the difference between them all. It was very disappointing, especially because the cafe is all about pork!  However, we were very impressed with the different Bloody Mary's they offered! We got a flight, and loved it! Our bartender Suzzie was awesome and sweet! We may try to go again and I hope to be able to update this review.

JTbO574d9A6hLZc3kicclA.text: Don't waste your time. We waited for an hour and twenty minutes to be seated. Once seated we waited another forty minutes to get food. The food that came was not up to the standard it should have been for an hour and twenty minute wait. The flight of bacon was OK, not worth $10 at all. The eggs benidict had hollandaise sauce from a packet that I could have made at home. The English muffins it sat on, yeah, have those at home too. The gravy on the biscuits from biscuits and gravy was super thick, not gravy like; finally the scrambled eggs had a slab of "pepper jack" thrown in top. The cheese was not even melted. It was still in the shape of the plastic wrap that it had been removed from. I wished I had checked Yelp before we went. It was super disappointing!

e-XJ6qAkqE-1zYzrbtfA3w.text: Mmmmmm..... Bacon! This place was great. Service was good and the food was better. We started off with the Oink Bloody Mary. I ordered mine spicy and it did not disappoint.  Then we ordered a bacon flight. You really can't go wrong with that. I ordered the Chorizo eggs Benedict. Sooo good. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

h7QRVjSoOzDNlDkcexVeqA.text: Stopped by for breakfast today.  I have never seen a place in a bigger state of confusion.  Not that busy and took a long time to get anyone to take our order.  The bacon flight that I had enjoyed previously came out with several strips that were almost to the burnt stage.  Our orders came out wrong.  Took the plates back and only got one right.  Loved it the first time we went but I doubt we will return.

cFS_tVyHgR6138nBJ0WcfA.text: Loved the bacon flight! Peppered bacon  was my favorite. Fun sharing and taste testing. Eggs Benedict awesome. French toast spectacular. Biscuits and gravy a letdown, kinda dry.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bacon flight
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Turkey avocado  eggs Benedict with ham substitute! Yum
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. And done

KUEJ9zv3KiiO0E13OkpyPg.text: First visit here after driving by for months. Sunday brunch...place was hopping busy as ascexpected. We were warmly greeted and seated as quickly as they could. Our server Linda was outstanding. She was hustling, but didn't rush the expected questions and ordering session. Menu is huge....our group of 5 couldn't decide on breakfast or lunch. In the end breakfast won and we all ordered different plates. Everything was excellent....Breakfast chimi, omelets, pancakes and the pork confit Eggs Benedict. Well that dish will make you weep with joy!  We made our return plans to try the lunch menu before we finished our breakfast. This is a popular place...come prepared to wait a bit, but oh so worth the wait!

JrUuxaGvVcx-o4R6e_TDTg.text: Ok.  We did have a long wait,  but it was well worth it! And the service was great,  so we didn't mind.  The. Bacon. Is. Amazing! I liked all of the flavors... and tried all of them :) We also shared the Oink Omelet and it was huge..and delicious. Tons of cheese and meat. I opted to have the sweet potato fries with the meal and wow! So tasty.  Can't wait to go back and try more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oink omelet with sweet potato fries! Yum!!

-yinb5tJdxZ5ZQn8adNkig.text: Had some time to kill before we headed to the airport. This place came highly recommended, glad we followed thru! Started with a flight of Bloody Mary's and a flight of bacon- Both were very good! I had the Oink Cafe French toast- loaded with strawberries & blueberries and whipped cream. So good, it didn't even need syrup! The wife had some Omelet with a huge biscuit and house potatoes, she also ordered a side of sausage gravy (which was really good). Overall, this place did not disappoint! Definitely will be back, thanks The Oink Cafe for having such a rad place! You need to be in So. Cal...

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Flight of bacon, list is on the upper left corner. Personally, I LOVED the jalapeño bacon!
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wifey ordered some omelet (sorry i don&#39;t know the name) with a biscuit and a side of sausage gravy and O&#39;Brien potatoes. She loved it.
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

gfzXtO2UjF8FfoNh9n-9Ig.text: Stopped their on a Saturday morning. Sat at the bar. The staff was great. Had Eggs, home fries and peppered bacon. The meal was outstanding , the coffee was refilled. They have 8 types of bacon and The Bloody Marys looked tempting. Stop by there and you will not be disappointed. Brought a to go order for my wife with the Jalapeno bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

EHT9cMQmwo94sPe_5tuPKQ.text: Tony! This is for you.  I absolutely love this place. Of course any place that offers Bloody Mary and bacon flights is a win win in my book.  The service is always awesome.  The food is great.  Now if they just served shrimp and cheese grits it would be perfect.

9FbcQOWEc-Y8yt6XpwetuA.text: This place is a hidden gem!!!! I pass by it all the time and it wasn't until Wednesday morning I decided to give it a try. I came in, hungry after the gym with three friends. Service was extremely welcoming and fast! I ordered the healthy choice omelet with fresh fruit. It was great! It came with turkey sausage crumbles in it which I loved. My friend ordered applewood bacon and hash browns. I am not a bacon fan whatsoever, but I have to admit it was good. Susie was our server, she was extremely friendly and very helpful when we had questions! My other friend ordered the 5 egg oink omelet. It was ginormous and he only had good things to say. The atmosphere and the decor of this place are SO CUTE. I cannot wait to come back with more friends to try out some more stuff!! I saw another table drinking a mimosa flight, I think, but I will for sure need to come back for some of that. Everyone should give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

NKc1hLvm8NU_D-Y8P8Djrg.text: I found this little place looking for a good breakfast place that isn't The Waffle House, which I enjoy, and came across The Oink Cafe. Everything is cooked well and the waitresses are nice. I strayed away from the standard bacon, and didn't think it was worth it. I hit it up every now and again, when I don't want to make the drive to WH.

oNpqb4yQhq_d51I4psuikg.text: Service was nice but waiter only checked on us twice so my water cup was empty for 15-20 min. (Inside was very loud, so sat outside) my biscuit on top of my biscuit breakfast sanywas so rubbery, i bet I could have bounced it off the ground. Scrambled eggs tasted like they came right from a box, hasbrowns soft. Bacon was divine. Pancakes were above average. Overall not great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

gReh4-oGWDSBsQ7qe6VrXQ.text: A few months ago, my husband and I stumbled on this place through "Yelp" saw some  delicous pancakes and wanted to give it a try. Plus, the name just sounds "Unique"  The wait time was about 15 - 20 minutes for a brunch sunday and we were happy to wait - no rush! We already knew what we wanted to order and did their Strawberry Cheesecake pancakes, Pork confit Benedict and 5 egg bacon omelet. Their Strawberry Cheesecake pancake was super delicious and we shared it as our pupu style - soo good. I had their Pork Confit Benedict, which was okay just needed a little more of the Hollandaise sauce.  Given that it was a sunday brunch and it was pretty packed in there, I understand service would be a little slower than usual and our waitress kept forgetting to bring certain items that we requested from her - like water, forks, ketchup, and hollandaise sauce. We had to ask the buster if he can help us and he happily assisted us by the time she came back to give us our items, we were done and ready to close out our check and head out.  If we do go back it'll be just to have the Strawberry Cheesecake to share!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pork confit Benedict... just need a little more sauce
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Our pupuz for starters ... was ono!
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

YrsXwqc12FRIti8iX0YZdA.text: I wanted a good breakfast with hashbrowns and Oink delivered.  I ordered the PV omelet with spinach, swiss, bacon and mushrooms.  It was great.  You get a side of bread, which includes the biscuit.  A great biscuit.  Yet the reason I went was for hash browns. Very crispy and tasted great.    The wife got the California Benedict. It was very good with avocados inside.    I am glad this place is nearby!  We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. PV omelet!  Crispy hasbrowns and biscuit.
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. California benedict with avocado

LXXwELUtErOpn9aD8TUrxg.text: First time here. Wanted something for breakfast. Food was So good and Arica our server gave awesome service! I would recommend this place to everyone. Too many unique things about this place to list. Try it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Maple bacon donut
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Flight of bacon

hwUqZ3FaYJwxhUTCXrEFQg.text: We have now been here several times.  They have a quick turn over so if you are there on a busy time you don't usually have to wait too long.  Having said that we have never felt rushed.  So far the food and service have been consistently good.  We drive up from Maricopa and its worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yummy Oink Breakfast Chimmi

VOaANhwPWya-OlpKEa1oeQ.text: Bacon is the attraction here.  We started out with a bacon sampler. Yes, the bacon was good, very good. My wife ordered Eggs Benedict. She didn't think they were bad, just that she's had better at other places. I had the biscuits and gravy.  Not a good choice. The biscuits were large but I thought they were overly dry. My opinion on the gravy was even worse. It really wasn't good. Not sure what the meat in the gravy was... some sort of sausage I suppose. Even though there should have been a side of hash browns, they never came. I will say that my granddaughter's pancakes looked great. If you're all about bacon then this is your place. For other breakfast, maybe not.

5Njw5dgqs-ZgqylnJPR4FQ.text: My girlfriends and I love trying out new breakfast spots! One Sunday out of the month we dress up and go out for Brunch. Was here on a Sunday, arrived at 10:00 a.m. and the wait for 6 people was 45 minutes. I completely understood as Sundays are busy, so we waited. Once we were seated we all ordered, our food was alright; however, special mention for the Apple Cider Bacon that was delicious. The service was subpar. I speak for our group collectively that this place would have been a lot better and more enjoyable had the service been more attentive. We live all over the valley so some us drove 35 minutes to be there and we decided this was not a place we feel is worth revisiting.

ORNoN5izRVgwHsNHD1e9kQ.text: Visited on a Sunday morning, as expected to place was very busy. Unfortunately there is not very much organization when it comes to the front hostesses area. There is little to no room to check in or wait the 40 minutes it takes to get a seat , which in fact she said it would only be 20 minutes. When finally taken back the hostess explains that they had multiple people call out. It's unfortunate because our food was great and the portions are huge, but the hectic feel made the restaurant really unenjoyable. Props to our server who was efficient at getting our orders in and to the cooks who made our food quickly. If it wasn't for them I would not recommend this place until they have a better system for getting customers through the door and seated.

Gym8vN_SRBT_VFXO4ENwpA.text: Oink for me was...Ouch ! Went to breakfast at The Oink Cafe with my wife. This cafe's claim to fame is bacon. I ordered a half flight of bacon,4 slices,of my choice. Also had the breakfast chimi with pork confit and scrambled egg covered in a chorizo & cheese sauce. Home fries on the side.  Food arrived and I look down at my plate and notice green and red peppers along with onion mixed in my home fries. NOT as described on the menu. Ok. Eat around them. One strike. Chimi looks good. Cut into it and ... You guessed it,more green peppers and onions mixed in with the pork and eggs. NOT as on the menu. Tasted the Chimi and it was awful. Pork confit taste murdered by veggies. Strike two. Ate my bacon and it was fine.  Here comes the manager/owner. He wants to now how things are?  He sees my half eaten plate and wonders. I explain the peppers & onions, not on the menu, have ruined my meal. He explains "Yeah,that's how it comes. Next time you'll know to order it without."  Next time? He doesn't offer to make it right in any way,shape or form. Strike three.  Waiting outside for my wife and the manager/owner comes up to me and says he looked at the menu, nowhere were peppers & onions listed on the menu in my items. He tells me they need to make it as the menu says or print new menus. Still no offer to make it right by me. So absorbed in the business that he forgot the customer.  I will not go back to The Ouch Cafe.

YLm4CItpHPpP7J499Bl_ag.text: Ate here at lunch time on a Thursday. Walked in and was seated promptly. I ordered a Bloody Mary, the full flight of bacon, and a BLT with jalapeno bacon. All was delicious. The Bloody Mary had an excellent spice mixture around the rim of the glass. The flight of bacon was cooked to perfection. It wasn't soggy or burnt. Just perfectly crisp. Jalapeno bacon BLT was also great. Bread nicely toasted. Lots of bacon in relation to veggies. All around a good meal. The hostess Desiree and the server Mo were both very attentive. Both came by multiple times to make sure everything was good. Will definitely come back!

PlJ-iowmi__SJ36uHLjnpA.text: Wanted to try this place for awhile. Not too impressed the place was very noisy , no one had a smile. The restaurant was very hot. No we were inside!!  When we try a new place we always have eggs Benedict, if the Benedict is good we will try something else the next time.. well not so great just ok.. don't think we will be coming back

PmZTu8CN80JmQp4fA4psOg.text: If you have never tried this place, you are missing out!! I used to eat at the one in Paradise Valley. If you LOVE breakfast food and you LOVE BACON, then park your rear here at Oink Cafe!!!

z7MNw6c8F4WmtdnIf2KUXg.text: It was ok. Ordered the Bacon benedict with the honey bacon, tasted like regular bacon. I thought maybe the wrong bacon was put on the plate but the waitress said that it wasn't a sweet bacon. Hubby got the Paradise Valley omelet, he enjoyed it very much.  The home fries were very crunchy and tasty. Service was ok, not great but not bad. The hostess did look like she just woke up and threw on whatever was available, a little off putting. If in the area might give another try but not going out of my way for it.

P6c12XS5tf7z8WYUWAw5uQ.text: Just went here for the third time. Funny we always get the same great waitress and table. Never have had a bad meal yet.  Portions are large and love the Togo cup of coffee. Kaitlyn will take care of you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

kxWIGU1kU0Fg26YysrVxXg.text: I was somewhat underwhelmed. Nothing was bad at all. But if you call yourself oink you should do something better than normal with pork. The bacon was good but it was bacon. Nothing special about it and 10$ for 8 pieces. I was looking for some hidden meat magic and left having seen none.

wnyI95xaGv_5PbWo2117xg.text: Waitress was nice and food was pretty good, but we waited for 30 min to get a table even though there were multiple open tables, the staff had just neglected to clean them. Also, we ordered and sat at our table for an additional 30 min before getting our food and had no drink refills or interaction with our server. This was all annoying, but the low rating is mainly because servers were arguing in plain site and the wait staff as a whole was quite rude and unwelcoming. Probably will never go here again.

88TftCgniNxXSXjt25b5zg.text: So bomb. They have a BACON SAMPLER. Do I need to say more? Excited to try the mimosa sampler next time. Really good service as well.

RscfOXptaWhNvb9oHf6-wA.text: Great spot for breakfast!! It does have a long wait on a Sunday but well worth it. They explained they have mimosa, bloody marry and bacon flights. Hubby got the chimichanga breakfast I got eggs breakfast. Everything was delicious. We will be back the next time we are in town.

7asFRlD2Epe3oK90RD_dvQ.text: A little wait but worth it....yummy food, great portions, good service but mabye a few more servers would help....will definitely be back

hHALUxn2qN9XQPsbV8E_Lg.text: I came here on Sunday when I was craving some breakfast food. I heard they had Bloody Mary's so I gave it a try. The bar was busy and didn't have any seats but the bartender noticed me right away and got me a drink while I waited for a seat. The manager noticed I was dining alone so she sat me really quickly. The food was delicious. I really enjoyed the bacon flight. My eggs were perfect and they checked on me frequently. I can't wait to go back this weekend!

04OBrkPEJlu2y1nnFOlO4Q.text: Has an interior paint job that makes you question their choices and want to throw up. Out of beans and overall mediocre food and service. Decent iced tea.

cRyV4MPBW86LkLAiM-AxPg.text: I've been to The Oink twice and chose one of the benedicts both times. Absolutely lovely breakfast - not too huge - not too heavy. Friendly quick service, coffee and water refilled as a matter of course.

cOjlOLR4xkoYi7xyD4g2CQ.text: Great concept but poorly executed, the bacon flight is amazing as is the Snapchat filter and the name. However the oink really disappoints. I wish the colors inside were more reflective of the name/logo, for example, brown, pink, tan, off white would be much more easier on the eyes vs the bright neon green and yellow on the walls which I simply don't understand unless I was at a laser tag place.   I wish they had fresh coffee creamers, fresh butter, I wish my bacon flight was a little warmer, I wish the breakfast burger was more gourmet/quirky/unique.... a chefs creation rather than a fat pork patty slapped on some buns with a sloppy egg and mediocre hash browns. I ordered the wrong thing but apart from the burger I just wish the place was more cool lol, it seems poorly executed to me and far from its actual potential.. more chic more attention to detail and better vision on the little things would make a big difference.   Oh it probably didn't help that when we sat down at our booth the table was very wet from a server wiping it down and consequently the menus were stuck like tape to the table... not a good start mr oink oink u fortunately I won't be back oh yea and don't serve a barrio blonde beer in an IPA San tan glass.. it's just not right, service was on point tho good job there :-)

V_LKBx7WF9sP15oCZeTVxg.text: Waited 50 minutes when quoted 20-25.  Prompt response when seated but after got our coffee we had nothing to stir with.  Took a few moments to flag someone down for silverware.  Food was ordinary.  Would not go out of my way to eat here again.

aX_ueXcY-wkx-mgZ5CQBBg.text: I normally never write reviews but today warranted a review. The nice hostess took our name and quoted a 20 minute wait-- no big deal, we happily waited. We were sat and brought coffee in a quick manner. We placed our order shortly after and this is where things we wrong. We started to see plates come out of the kitchen for tables that had been sat after us-- again, no big issue, we had time and dismissed it. However, after waiting 30 minutes we were out of coffee and thirsty. My friend asked for waters and the waitress only brought 1. She then was not to be seen for another 15 minutes, which led us to share our small glass of water. Finally we were teased by food! The runners came and they had the order for another table. They apologized and proceeded. Finally, a manager happened to swing by- he wanted to offer more coffee. After 3 cups of coffee, a small water, and no sight of food for the last 50 minutes, the last thing we wanted was a coffee refill. We explained to him the situation and finally after over an hour, things were looking up for the food. Our original waitress had been waiting tables around the restaurant during this time and did not check in at all. It's almost as if she was avoiding our table! Right around the 1 hour 15 mark we finally got our food. It was okay. I had come in before and really enjoyed it. Anyways we scarfed it down due to the wait we had just endured. Near the end of the meal the waitress came by and admitted that she never put our original order in. What?!? She said it was too busy. We will give it another shot because we've both worked in food and know things happen but it's quite difficult to wanna come back if our whole day is put on hold because a waitress forgot to hang a ticket.

33a2VIJFP-jNNOaLifk7ig.text: THE WORST EXPERIENCE! Please do not waste your time or money at this place. So we get there and they say is a 30-40 minute wait. We see getting people called left and right. There are 4 empty tables just sitting there. Then we see the manager whisper "who is this couple, they have been waiting awhile". So I finally get up to go and talk to her about the wait, then she calls my name. When she calls my name she says "the kitchen is so behind, we just had two workers quit" uhhh you don't tell customers that!? My friend hyped this place up to me and so I turned to him and said asked "are you sure this is a good place". So we sit down and I order a flight of mimosas. The waitress had two other tables sit down at the same time so she was triple sat. So I just see the third table the was sat receive their drinks after waiting 15 minutes for our mimosas. So I get up and go to the manager again and say "we sat down first and the third table is getting drinks, (the bar is empty by the way so it's really no longer busy at this point) this is turning into a horrible experience, and I told her my friend recommended this place and now I'm wondering why" she tries apologizing and keep saying they are backed up. I'm in customer service and that is not the excuse you keep giving. So she comes to the table and says our food is coming out now and she apologizes again and says she will pay for the food but not the mimosas. I will never be back to this place. The bacon is as burnt, the mimosas were messy, and the french toast was soggy with blueberry jam". This place is so overrated please do not expect a pleasant experience because it just won't happen. This place obviously treats its employees the same way its customers. AWFUL! I'm not even the type to put a review like this but it was so awful and I don't want anyone else wasting their time on this overrated joke of a restaurant. Spend your money on a place that appreciates you and their employees!!

TGUqUKIdMgGiqwDKzIBL7Q.text: I've been to Oink Cafe on warner quite a few times, the food is good but the service is so bad that I won't be returning. The hostesses don't welcome you, no smiling faces when you enter the restaurant. Then the waitresses are short with you and rush you through your meal. I've only interacted with 1 waitress who was exceptionally nice but she wasn't even serving our table. Not sure why the staff seems so unhappy but it totally takes away from the food. I'll find a new breakfast/brunch spot

Q2T5AjfuvnlYZZ1E6JFTSg.text: Awesome Mother's Day here at Oink. Great food and the service was superb! Thanks Ryan and Desiree!!!

XXhJtKSdx7eCo-hnfE58Ug.text: The most overrated and overpriced brunch place around. Four of us had brunch at 1245 pm on a Tuesday and it was 90% empty. Seating and service were fine but some of the food was nasty. The sandwiches were fine but the 'Cuban', highly recommended, was fatty. My Omelet was over cooked and stingy on the fillings. Ditto on the hash browns. When the waitress asked how everything was we told her nicely, and she said 'so sorry' and left. Would've been nice to see a manager. Almost $30 each couple plus tip. Save your money and go to Denny's.

jEJIrYoymvr8kniAX3zncg.text: I took my family there in November and split a chorizo omelet with my daughter. I shared a bloody marry that had bacon in it. It was delicious. I'm definitely going back.

T0DrW_Mvguttev_Bwni6xg.text: The mini Mimosas and Bloody Marys are pretty cool and the food was decent.  The bartender was a little sharp though.

YkWskwnCdl_r6jekeT8aYA.text: Finally went here, with a group of seven, so got to see several choices. Noise level is too high. Food is okay, but not great; I'd go to US Egg or First Watch instead, as far as other places I've been to. Maple bacon doughnut is a joke-doesn't look appetizing, very heavy texture. Eggs cooked perfectly, hash browns overdone, bacon was, well, BACON. Biscuit good. Coffee good. Everyone left full, but none of us in a hurry to go back. And two of us live really close.

JaWc0qLSlYtzK0hb89E_7g.text: This is the best breakfast place in town in my opinion. The bacon is to die for. The quality of service and the food is amazing. Today the dish wasn't so great  (poached eggs were cooked too long) and I didn't eat it. The owner came over and said it wasn't acceptable and took the dish off. We tipped off the original amount but the service was outstanding. Thank you. ! Enjoy!!

vuSCVAaGkgmygSSgNxEvQw.text: Food was ok. They are dry.... gravy and biscuits. And the burrito. Eggs and fries were great. Waiting for the meal was about 10 min too long. Some of the food carriers need to be aware of kids and babies. They were hovering hot plates over my 1 year old.

wq3WO_aSdDDCnLrHa7rvww.text: We are sitting in The Oink Cafe still waiting for food. It's been over an hour and we're getting pretty hungry! Our waitress told us we need to be patient because it's their busy time! Then staff up the kitchen! I don't care if it's your busy time,  an hour and fifteen minutes is ridiculous!

4xKb8Wc0OMhBQPaIG_A-DQ.text: I was really disappointed with my food. I have been to the other location plenty of times and have been overly satisfied but this barely held up to that. My bbq pork sandwich was super fatty, salty in some places, and bland in others. The pork barely tasted like bbq. I crave this sandwich! And i was so let down to have paid $12 for goop :c

9PLdTHDfGhKTKsd2GbBzDA.text: Great Mother's Day breakfast at Oink! We had a large party and they went above and beyond to make it work for us. Bacon flight is a must do!

Aqe8miPDxDHOf2P19HtYRw.text: If you like bacon, this is your breakfast spot. They have bacon flights!! I didn't know that was even out in the universe. Hooray for bacon! They have every kind from maple to pepper to jalapeno bacon. My favorite was the jalapeno, but they are all bacon so they are all delicious of course.   It's standard breakfast aside from that. Everything was good with the exception of the biscuits. I prefer a light fluffy biscuit and these were SO heavy. Solid dough.   The service was great. We had a lovely lady named Susie, who was genuinely friendly vs robotic service at most establishments. I'll be back!

G_C0EH_GqWY21N5lhzO3dA.text: We went here after seeing the "Bacon Flight" and other unique combinations on the menu. The bacon flight came out almost instantly (before our food and drinks) so you could tell they just had lots of bacon ready to go and who knows how long ago it was cooked. We really would have preferred to eat it with our meal. The bacon was not piping hot, the flavors didn't match the flight menu, and the bacon was absolutely lackluster. So disappointing.   The bloody mary flight was absolutely delicious, but it took forever to come out, I had to ask and check in on it. This should have come out shortly after we ordered, because it's not something you can get through quickly so it would have been nice to be able to drink them while we were waiting for our food.   When you order blueberry pancakes, you expect to have blueberries mixed into the batter. Not here. The put about 10 blueberries on top of the stack of pancakes. Again, disappointing with the presentation, but the pancakes and ham did taste good.   The pork patty breakfast burger was also lackluster. Huge patty, but a small amount of hash browns and a tiny egg on top. With such a huge patty, you need equally good portions of other toppings, and this was very disproportionate.   Over a $50 breakfast and extremely disappointed. Definitely will not be back.

MGWnWnu9D9PtBpmZJkVXlg.text: Went in this place on a Saturday. It wasn't too early in the morning and we didn't have to wait for a table at all. The place is clean and the service was great. The manager came to our table to ask how everything was, I feel like restaurants aren't doing that as much anymore. It was nice to see. The pricing was SUPER reasonable and we ate a lot of food and it was less than $40.  I will definitely be going back! Great place!

lxDp8oabX2QjsvlvjDFguw.text: I said just this morning that i really really wanted bacon for breakfast!! We went over to another retail establishment and saw this place on the way! How fortuitous! So after finishing with my transaction we headed over. They had a 45 minute wait for 2 people at 1130 on a Sunday. Wow! So we had a third errand to run. We put our name down and hoped for the best! We got back and although they called our name they put us up next. They have an outdoor patio/waiting area. Not sure if they have table service out there or not. The hostess was decidedly quiet/unfriendly. We got no "thank you" or "have a nice day" when we left. The green-shirted manager was walking around making sure tables were being turned over. I completely agree with both the loud noise issue and the lousy decor. The hubs & i were sitting next to each other and we could barely hear each other. The schizophrenic color scheme is troublesome.  The waitress was nice but the service was slow. We had to wait after we got seated and then waited to have our order taken and then waited for our lunch and then waited for our check...you get the idea. I read another review that mentioned about the kitchen staff bringing out someone's meal using a dirty rag touching their food. I saw that. Ew. Anyway, we ordered mimosas which were good, but small for $6.99. Then we order the bacon flight. Very tasty but again, paper thin like what everyone else has mentioned. I ordered the oink benedict and hubs ordered the pork confrit omelet. Both tasted decent but not *omg* amazing. We got water refilled twice and asked for a box for my leftover sweet potato fries. Lunch was $50 which was a bit hefty. Oh, the bathrooms were clean with 2 stalls and parking was a challenge. All in all, great concept but still have a few kinks to iron out yet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. 2 people lunch time on Sunday
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oink Benedict with sweet potato fries. Yummy! Amazing! 2/12/17

sLZUUbGe4bWzXqcvhheSpg.text: Oink Cafe in Tempe is amazing! Our server, Rachel, was so attentive and nice! Ordered the half flight of bacon and devoured every bite along with my meal. They have a bunch of different types of bacon here. I will frequent this location because of the great service my party received!

PpHqdlrRkVCnO2diqhn7tw.text: This place was fantastic. The mimosas were spectacular. Bring a designated driver. If you're a bacon lover you have to try the bacon flight. The food was fantastic here. We are definitely coming back.

VXZX4NcMzNQHEDPPRHMNkg.text: First time here and I will be back.  Good service, nicely decorated and very clean.  All the food was very good but two things make this place special.    1 - the owners.  They were working the floor, clearing tables, refilling drinks, delivering food, greeting guests.  You could tell they take pride in what they built and want to make it feel like you're a guest at their kitchen table.    2 - the Ranchero Chimi...big enough to share but so good you don't want to.  The pork, ranchero beans and home fries wrapped in a perfectly fried tortilla covered in a chorizo cheese sauce...excellent.  Never had anything like it but will be going back for it for sure!

KcpoNRfvAz-0NGjmTPLlig.text: Definitely over rated and over priced. It was super crowded and we had to wait for an hour for the table. After we got our table we had to wait for an another 40 mins for food. I would have not been complaining if the food was worth it. But unfortunately that food was alright and definitely over priced.

bMBJbgdQh4MXrBhe_2WXMw.text: Two words: BACON FLIGHT. They offer 8 kinds - my favorite are the Jalapeno and Applewood...and of course, their freshly made MAPLE BACON DONUT HOLES - it's the perfect sweet, savory, crunchy deliciousness your life needs now! If that doesn't lure you in, another must try is their ARIZONA OMELET with chorizo and their house made RANCHERO SAUCE, which tastes incredible on everything. What can I say? I'm a fan. Oink had great service, food, ambience, Mimosas, Bloody Mary's, Coffee and much more! I highly recommend this place!

9KGBWwqLMr50U2Z_HoL3VA.text: This place is fantastic!! Bacon flights. Bloody Mary flights. Mimosa flights. Beer on tap! Amazing food, huge portions. I had the chimi, my husband had the bacon eggs Benedict. Both were excellent. Very friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere. We will be back!

c-70qJZe3aUr85DSA8Y7rQ.text: Visited the Oink Cafe for the very first time! Very cool and clean place. If you like Pork, this is the place for you! We started off with the Oink Bloody Mary that had Olives, Limes, Lemon, Celery stalk and of course, BACON! They were absolutely delicious! It was hard to decide what to order, their menu is so enticing.   My wife ordered the Chicken Omelette and I ordered the Pork Burger Sandwich (8 oz sausage patty, Hash Browns and a fried egg, on a bun) it was AWESOME! My wife said her chicken omelette was to die for! We couldn't eat it all so we brought some home.   Our waitress was JoLee was absolutely phenomenal! She was quite attentive to us and she makes a good Bloody Mary! We will definitely go back to Oink Cafe for Breakfast or Lunch. I highly recommend the Oink Cafe

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oink Bloody Mary

iAmGEIkwc4IG9JcBTK4niQ.text: We ate at The Oink Cafe recently and have to honestly state that it's over hyped.   The restaurant had nice seating and decor.  Customer service was excellent but it wasn't busy on the week day that we went.  The Bloody Mary was very expensive at $11.00 and packed with ice.  The Bloody Mary had an undercooked piece of bacon in it. You couldn't taste any alcohol.  Don't waste your money on it.  I ordered an omelet that was very strange. Apparently they whip up your eggs and the chorizo together.  Any good chef prepares an omelet fluffy and the other add ins separate. The omelet is then stuffed with the meats and onions etc. cheese is added to inside and out and served.  The omelet wasn't very good.   My husband ordered biscuits with gravy.  The biscuits are hard and taste like flour.  The gravy was not made well either.   We eat out regularly and we are cooks ourselves.  This restaurant had poorly made food that lacked the flavors expected.   Honestly do your self a favor and go somewhere else for breakfast and lunch.

PmYKZCHT21saXvE4ORAp2w.text: Service was great.  The french toast was gooey and had no flavor at all (maybe bumped it up and add vanilla or cinnamon to the egg batter).  The bacon (the real reason we went) was...eh.  French toast combo comes with 2 pieces.  I got 1 and a half and was given the wrong flavor.  All the bacon we got was overcooked, the ends normally should have a golden juicey, but crispy texture.  Each piece we had shattered when you broke it...just way overdone.

Cy5BfuR_ULiwVDmdIaUmiQ.text: This place was OK, but I'd say more on the 2.5 stars.  The interior decor (or better said, that hideous green paint job) is jarring and so is all that lighting, so already walking in I'm irritated :\  Our server was warm and nice and all... My dish was not attractive nor enticing... just a big pile of what look like eggs and chorizo thrown in a blender and then cooked in a huge pile on my plate.  The potatoes looked delicious and tasted good.. but the egg/chorizo mess was not appealing... I wish I could've ordered them a different way so it would not look that way.  ANyway, I enjoyed my bacon at least!  My husband's dish was kind of the same .. big blob of eggs, not very appetizing.   I love the concept of a bacon-centered restaurant because I LOVE BACON and all things PIGGY but I think there is a lot of room for improvement at this place.. first off with the interior environment and the presentation of the food.. that alone would make a huge difference!

EeoIARWmGJb-6P9L4lm-9w.text: Always consistently great food made with quality ingredients, and the service is top notch.

I6gc-iFWfJ2krgPWxDRsDw.text: Oink oink.   I like The Oink Cafe. I've been here at least three times now and I'm always happy with the Bloody Mary flight, the Oink Chimichanga, and their biscuits. The mimosa flight is decent and the bacon flight is more of a novelty than anything. Service here is prompt and friendly and the restaurant is clean. I'm never upset getting food here and I'll probably be back soon for more Bloody Marys... especially the Verde Mary.

G47Wy0WxTPt5JHYV15btag.text: Our first stop here in the Phoenix area. We chose to come here based on its closeness to our hotel and it ended up hitting the spot after a 5 hour drive. First off, they have a bloody mary flight?! You've got my full attention after that. I believe they have 6 options to choose from, we liked the 4 we chose, only get the siracha one if you really like siracha though. We tried the mimosa flight as well, I wouldn't really recommend this unless you like sweet drinks a lot. The classic and the cranberry were good but the peach mango and blueberry pomegranate tasted like really sugary juice.   Now for the food! This was honestly one of the best eggs benedict I've ever had! My boyfriend had the spanish style with chorizo and enjoyed his too. We were surprised because this place seems to be known for their bacon dishes.   The decor is super cute and bright and the bathroom was clean. The hostesses were welcoming and the service was good. I liked how they have a bar too even though they only serve breakfast and lunch, you don't usually see that. Definitely check this place out!

0OoSz5oIYOSaCjnSco406g.text: Bacon - good! Service and wait times - bad!  Maybe it was just the ASU freshman of a server that I had that was crap, I mean i get it, i wouldn't wanna feed the annoying people bacon all day, and I know you are just counting down the days until coachella! But for real, dont bring my bacon flight out after my entree comes out, WTF is wrong with you, dont you know us adults take our bacon annoyingly seriously???   Food was awesome, the manager was great, the wait time wasn't all bad! But seriously if could curse without my review getting taken down, I would say worse about our server.. 4 outta 5 will return!

uzJEkqcK-EQpIAGnIVoVCA.text: Definitely the worst bacon I've had ,  even went bacon once more to make sure it wasn't a fluke.  I mean it's called oink cafe and they can't make / cook bacon correctly.  I'm not sure my dog would eat it.

xMx8Bx3VTtQ_B8qNVMeSww.text: After passing Oink Cafe many times on my way to work I knew I had to try them, so I grabbed my son and his friend and off we went. It was Saturday around 12ish so the wait wasn't that bad.  After we were seated I checked out the drink menu, and I was pretty excited to see they had a Verde Mary and knew I had to order one!  Then I checked out the food menu and went with the Bacon Benedict which was a base of an English muffin then jalapeno bacon covered by poached eggs and topped with hollandaise sauce and came with a side of hash browns.  About 10 minutes went by and I asked our server how were the drinks going, and she said oh they are doneI've seen them over there at the bar waiting for me and then she left again, no explanation on if she  she was busy covering someone else table or not, the place wasn't that packed.  A few more minutes went by and the drinks were brought to us.  The Verde Mary  was a house Verde bloody Mary mix and vodka pour into a glass with a salted rim and garnished with tomatillo, jalapeno and cucumber.  This was a good Verde Mary, I just expected more of a tomatillo/jalapeno flavor.  Our order came out, and well I wasn't that impressed, the hollandaise sauce was on point and tasty, the eggs were poached perfectly, but the bacon was burnt as well as the hash browns. Breakfast over all was kind of disappointing. My son & his friend's meal were good though. Maybe it was a busy day before we got there and we just got the tail end of it, I don't know and I am sure I will be back to try them again, I just hope next time would be better.

7ddLIGppYEqgabGJ04HQBA.text: Stopped here for breakfast because we wanted to try something new. The first impression of the decor was "Wow look at that neon green paint!!". We thought about sitting outside but it didn't look very nice. We weren't sure it was used for dining or not. Our visit was during the week so the place was pretty empty. We had to wait a bit for service. My husband got the eggs Benedict (pricey) and I got eggs. Of course, we got bacon with our meals but it tasted like plain bacon no flavor. The bacon was cooked within an inch of its life so maybe that's why it didn't taste that great. The waitress was nice but the service was just ok and the food was just ok. Not sure we would come back because it was just ok...

mCQGHvzJ3mXkFfjLyBnfew.text: My husband and I went here for brunch today and were seated immediately. I didn't care for the table location; it was directly behind the hostess stand so I kept feeling gusts of cool air on my back when people would walk in and a lot of employees were rushing back and forth by our table which was a little distracting. Husband ordered the 1/2 flight of bacon (1 honey, 1 pepper, 2 churro) and the biscuits and gravy, and he really liked it. I ordered the three pigs in a blanket. So much food! It was really yummy and I especially loved the syrup.  Service was really attentive. I really want to go back when it warms up a little and try my luck out on the patio.

XagHIHqhQXslM2MRGdPqiQ.text: The Oink Cafe has amazing breakfast food!  I came here this morning around 9:00 a.m. (Saturday morning) with my friend. We were looking to try a new place, because we love exploring new food in the area and came across The Oink Cafe.  Service:  We had the most exceptional service ever! We wanted to share a cinnamon roll, kind of like for a "breakfast dessert" after our breakfast, so she went to the kitchen, got the last cinnamon roll and saved it for us in a box and kept it on our table until we were ready for it to be warmed up. So sweet of her. She also made suggestions for us when we were debating on what to order for the menu. She knew the food and based off of what we preferred and like, made a suggestion on that. Our water glasses were constantly refilled and we were never kept hanging.   Interior: The place wasn't too crowded when we came here and we were seated immediately upon arriving. There are booths and also tables and chairs to sit at. Next to the kitchen, there's a huge chalkboard wall with pretty drawings of some of the specials of the day/week. This is a nice artistic piece and unique to the place.  Drinks: They have a great mimosa selection including blueberry pomegranite that my friend tried. They also have a lot of bloody mary choices.   Food:  *The Oink French Toast Combo* All of the combos come with a side of an egg and your choice of sausage or one of their bacons. The waitress convinced me to go for the Oink French Toast instead of the regular one. Texas Toast dipped in their batter and dipped in crushed Cap'N Crunch cereal. The French toast was then topped with a homemade blueberry sauce, strawberries, blueberries, whipped cream, and powdered sugar. I will definitely come back to order this breakfast dish. It was absolutely amazing! I like it when my French toast is dense and a little chewy, well cooked through, and this was just that. The crunch on top added to the overall taste and made the French toast that much better! The warmness of the toast with the coolness of the berries and cream was the perfect combination. It was like a party in my mouth. I ordered the chef's choice of pecan bacon. It was nice and crispy, not too sweet, had just a hint of pecan.  *Pancake Combo* 2 fluffy plain pancakes with a side of your choice of an egg and either bacon or sausage. My friend went with the scrambled eggs and also the chef's choice of pecan bacon. Verdict: some of the fluffiest pancakes ever consumed.  I highly recommend this cafe and would definitely come back again! I'm going to tell all my friends around here to come here because their food is bomb!!

BwM9-7rg6-1D-KJJ9VXQnw.text: Our 1st time trying this place after it was recommended by a friend.  This is a good spot if you love breakfast.  The menu is NOT overpriced like some other trendy brunch places nearby and the food is all scratch made. We had the breakfast chimi, which my wife loved and I did the pancake combo.  The pancakes were fluffy but. It too fluffy.  Just right.  I added the applewood smoked bacon...I'll attempt to eat my way through the bacon options (8 different types) We got these pretty early so it wasn't very busy, but the trendy music was pumping (not to loud though) and I tell tell it get hopping later in the morning.

XP5YWl0rSkBmt90rjId5wA.text: Popular place to come to on a Sunday.   We were told it would be about a 25 minute wait, but only waited about 10 minutes so it was a nice surprise. We were seated by a nice hostess then greeted by our very rushed waitress. She seemed very stressed, and it made me stress a bit as well. She asked for our drinks and we asked for waters, because we still needed to look at the menus. As we looked through the menu we also went ahead and decided to have our food order ready just because she looked very rushed. She came by and I decided to order for me and my friend (not something I ever do, but felt like I had to). As I was ordering and getting the the words out she would cut me off which was annoying, because there were substitutions and additions we wanted to do. Finally got my order in ....   First we got our mimosa flight which was really good however when it got to us it was really messy because it was spilled all over. So every time I went to pick up the drink it was wet and it would drip all over so i had to basically clean the mimosa cups. I had already cleaned up around them before I even started drinking them. Then we got the flight of bacon, but the only one that had a distinct taste was the jalapeno bacon the others tasted the same and the presentation again was awful. They brought it out and it was very greasy and honestly did not look very appetizing. They were okay. Lastly they brought out our breakfast entrees and with my omelet I added mushrooms, but no mushrooms were found. My friend ordered a biscuit and got an English muffin with her omelet. There were a few mistakes and the food was decent, but it could have been a lot better and more presentable and less rushed which could have avoided some of these issues I think.

m4pcWw4079NMk0bsq5v0DQ.text: Food was amazing. Service was good it was very busy but it was well worth the wait. French Toast was excellect. I loved the cheif choice bacon which was Cherry smoked.

n7q3njIQDbmn4SEHk4YL0g.text: Went here for breakfast Friday morning.  We were seated promptly and greeted by all of the staff.  Our server was Emma.  She was super attentive and friendly and always smiling.  I had the Arizona Omelet with Chorizo, onions, and cheddar cheese topped with a homemade spicy ranchero and avocado, with a side of applewood bacon.  It was spicy, I'll say that, but the taste was outta this world.  Next time I'm in town, I'm coming here again.

oNBnteuqlPFbHP3K2tWqvA.text: We just had lunch at the Tempe location. There was no waiting for lunch. We had the 50/50 burger and the club sandwich with fries. The portion sizes were on the large size so bring your appetite. The food was excellent. The burger did not need any condiments as it was very moist and flavorful.  The club was huge. Needed 2 hands to handle it. The ham was not processed ham. Our wait staff was very attentive and kept our drinks filled. We will definitely be going back soon.

9oVOWilWZ0xFIe27tftNVw.text: I needed something new and flash for breakfast, but I didn't want to drive to North Scottsdale, so I checked my Yelp app, and found The Oink Cafe. THE OINK CAFE The Oink Cafe is on the southwest corner of Warner and McClintock, in Tempe, Arizona. The Oink Cafe was first opened in Phoenix in 2012, by owners Donnie Baxla, and his sisters, Heather Clauser and Joan Roeber, of Peter Piper Pizza franchises fame. The Oink Cafe is a scratch-made breakfast and lunch menu, including eggs, omelets, chorizo, biscuits and gravy, pancakes and waffles. THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE I have to be honest - as soon as I saw the name, I wanted the place to be adorable, and it was. Even though The Oink Cafe is in a strip mall situation, the particular corner it's on is quite established, and the foliage is mature, which makes it look less strip mall-y and nice. The interior is bright, cute, and super clean. I totally love the pig vibe mixed with the edgy raw architecture. The hostess sat me right away, and my server, Mo, was right over. She took my order very quickly, and brought out everything just as fast. I tried the 8-piece bacon flight. OH. MY. GOD. SUPERB. The bacon flight came with applewood, honey, jalapeno, pepper, sugar, hickory, apple cider, and pecanwood flavors. My favorites were the sugar and jalapeno flavors, but all were SUPERB. I also tried the strawberry cheesecake pancakes. Yes. Yes. All the YES! They were utterly fantastic! The Oink Cafe also has a full bar, so I sampled their peach mimosa AND their famous Tito's Bloody Mary. CONCLUSION Everything was outstanding. I have zero complaints. I highly recommend The Oink Cafe, and I will definitely be coming back. 5/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Plenty of parking out front. *There are 3 locations: Paradise Valley, Tempe, and Tucson. *For more information: oinkcafe.com

DWRu4gij96UOjX5qD28pwA.text: Went to Oink Sunday, go the Mimosa Flight.  I think they use a sparkling white wine that is kind of dry.  The flavors of the mimosa (blueberry pomegranate, peach, cranberry and grapefruit) were not very noticeable, the grapefruit was the most noticeable.  The wine is kind of dry which personally for me is not my favorite, i like a sweet wine or champagne that is sweet.  I had the breakfast sandwich, was perfect and yummy.  My mom go the french toast and chose the honey bacon.  Now this is where i am confused, i think if you focus on an item then that item should be amazing.  The name is Oink cafe and says bacon on the sign.  They have bacon flights and bacon everything but the bacon is like the kind you would buy in a pack at the store, even the pictures people post make the bacon look mediocre.  I was expecting a nice thick piece with tons of flavor, it was a thin, tough piece of smoke flavored bacon, absolutely nothing special.  Wouldn't go back again.

Vm-BTMOFBajzRlRqVErPHg.text: The thought of bacon directed our bicycles to the Oink Cafe for brunch, but a crowd surrounding the place almost drove us away. When we saw the bar serving bloody Mary's we were in. We were told the wait was about 30 minutes and enjoyed a yummy, rather spicy Bloody Mary.  The colors in place where odd, I thought neon green was back in the 80s?  After our half hour wait, we were seated and noticed several other empty tables which seemed strange.  It was also very hard to talk as it was loud!  We ordered the bacon flight which was very interesting; I loved sampling the 10 varieties and amazed at how different each was.  We shared the chicken fried steak with biscuits and gravy were great.

4BhZJV8NZvNCqdiDzzGgsQ.text: From out of town, wanted to try something new for breakfast/brunch.....the cafe name caught my attention. I had the Huevos Rancheros with Chorizo and wife had Denve Omelette....both were totally awesome.  Also got the flight of bacon to try, glad I did.

KVhl43IIfbsDOPYJ03tHMA.text: I've been driving by this place since it opened wanting to stop in and try it.   Today I had the chance to stop in for breakfast.  Service was great and the food was delicious. Portions were good sized for a big eater like me.   I tried the Oink omelette which I would recommend if your hungry and need to fill up.

otfTgh9tVBlejykNZNytBg.text: What a delightful restaurant! The bacon flight is a must-do (if you just go for a half-flight, I recommend peppered, hickory smoked, pecan smoked, and jalapeno). I ordered the bacon and spinach omelet and a biscuit. Both were terrific.  It was nice to see a packed house. The restaurant that used to occupy this space was never on a wait list.

rFiS43WQZrcbgfXd64UDqg.text: Good food, a bit pricey.  6 of us bill came to about 80 plus tax.  Will come back again and try lunch.

sQPZI3CtDoI7bGKV4-RB4w.text: The Oink has become one of my favorite breakfast spot, which is shocking because I'm not a huge fan of pork or bacon! I know, I know, how can you not like bacon? Well, I guess I just needed a place to expand my bacon horizons! My fiance and I got their bacon flight and I've never appreciated this breakfast staple as much as I did in that moment. Now, onto the meal. Ive only been here twice, so I've gotten the chorizo eggs Benedict and the pork confit breakfast chimi. Again, not a huge fan of pork, but my good lord was it delicious. It was smokey, had a little spice, and incredibly filling. I ate the whole chimi. The chorizo eggs Benedict were also fantastic. I've never enjoyed benedict so much before. I've also tried the French toast and waffles since my fiance is more of a sweets for breakfast kinda guy, and those were wonderful too. He also got an omelette once and it was probably bigger than his head! Their portions are a very good size so you'll definitely be leaving full.   So if you're looking for great breakfast, a beer or Bloody Mary, and a very full stomach then come to Oink cafe!

BQ0ves-saaCGcTl4xNqEaw.text: Service was horrible! I called in an order at 10:13, I was literally across the street at a SB cafe relaxing, I walked over at 10:30 am, walked up to the bar, 2 ladies were busy fixing a receipt on the register, 3rd lady was behind the bar, I was greeted for a pickup by a 4th waitress, provided my name, got my check, paid and saw they were busy figuring something out, so I told her no rush. At 10:43, I had to catch someone and inquire about my to go order, the rude lady behind the bar, must have forgotten, she went to the kitchen to check, came back and said it will be a few more minutes, puzzled, I mentioned to her that it had already been at least 30 minutes since I called it in. She countered, I'll check the time, seriously lady, as if I would lie, I held up my phone, smiled and said, phones don't lie! At 10:52, I continued to sit at the bar, waiting, then I had to catch another waitress walking by, asked her to cancel my order at 10:56. The hostess finally came over and was shocked that I cancelled, although she was very nice about it, I informed her of the time and that I shouldn't have to wait over 40 min for a phoned in order. I only ordered oatmeal, side of bacon, Turkado Benedict sandwich. I really wish I was able to taste what they had to offer, but I think 45-50 min waiting time is certainly unreasonable for a phone in, if I were sitting at a table, that would be really ridiculous and the waitress working the bar today, should never have contact with People, better yet, I wouldn't want her preparing my meal with such a distasteful attitude and when I was getting my refund, she still had the nerve to state her opinion with her back turned. I hope management pays attention to the comments, this one the one time I failed to read the reviews for this restaurant, it appears to be an issue with staff and service.

9pDBbrYZF__wcpYrOQL3Rg.text: Food is great, and the servers have always been good.  Area for improvement is the hostess, each time we've come, we know there is a wait and never had an issue with it but your hostesses border on rude.  First face of your establishment, the only thing I would would work, everything else is great.  Will it cause me not to come back, no because have waited it and tried the food, for others that haven't,  had this could be a deterrent.

VnMRX2MPKocgnhJqM_9G9g.text: Yelp led us here for brunch, and we really enjoyed it! On first impressions, there's adorable decor and service was quick and attentive.  We shared a mimosa flight (Oink, Spicy Thai, Verde & Maria), the half bacon flight (Pepper, Hickory, Jalapeno & Apple Cider), Pigs in a Blanket with home fries, and biscuits & gravy. Yeah, we feasted lol! We were shocked by the amount of food, particularly with the pigs in a blanket. We were expecting smaller, grocery store-sized sausage links, but we got large hot dog sized links wrapped in huge pancakes! It was all very good, but the homemade gravy and the home fries were the stars for us. The Oink and Verde bloodies were both delish, but the others were so-so; the base mix was completely different and tasted like tomato juice.  Service was perfection, and we thought adding the little note on the flights indicating which order things came in was a really nice touch. The flights are such a good and unique idea for an easy upsell. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yogurt parfait delivered. Large portion and the fruit is incredibly fresh!
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chorizo omelet delivered! Huge portion and very good. Just a hint of spice, not at all overwhelming.
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Half Bacon Flight

DJT52uyPCahlr88X9V4hMw.text: Oink you are a solid C. It's not bad, and it's nothing great. I have been here twice and the food is beyond underwhelming. The only reason I give a solid C is because they do make a DAMN good Bloody Mary. This is the only reason I got talked into coming here a 2nd time.   8 strip of bacon on a board seems pretty lack luster as I watch the wait staff try to present it.  It's bacon.

lnrzfOqsrAH2-LutUMMuNA.text: So we stopped in this morning to try bfast... The wait was decent around 15-20min, so not bad for a Sat Morning. The benches to sit and wait we're awful. So uncomfortable... The location waiting was right in front of the door so it was really hot every time someone went in or out....  Then we got seated... It was an awkward table that shifted under us several times, and it was in an odd location near the kitchen with servers and guests walk-in around both sides or our table...  However the chairs were much more comfortable than when we were waiting on the bench.   We started with a bacon flight!! Really can't go wrong there... Hubbs and I shared. The cherrywood and peppered were my faves. I also got a bloody Mary flight. The Verde was spectacular! The Thai was nice and spicy but nothing to write home about, the pink was full and robust, and the classic...well, how could you go wrong there. My hubbs tried a mimosa flight... He said he will stick with orange as all the others seems syrup like and super sweet. He also had an Irish coffee. He didn't like the cup (which I loved) I also tried and iced coffee with mocha...it was more like chocolate milk. I took out a mountain of ice...luckily our great server was attentive and thoughtful, and topped off my coffee with all that extra mocha it really was enough for like 3 drinks... Now for the food. I had the oi k omlette. It was good. HUGE portion sizes!! I liked the hashbrowns and biscuit a lot. Hubbs got chicken fried steak (he ate about half which means he wasn't really a fan) I took a bite... It was meh...except the Gravy! Wow was that delicious!!!  Service was wonderful! I mean there is no substitute for good service. Over all an okay place. I would deff come back to try lunch. Prices are a bit high, but as mentioned previously they are huge portion sizes.

LOqvTUN_mJmf_SkzMZmBBA.text: This was my last breakfast spot in Chandler Arizona. I enjoyed visiting this location for breakfast because of the mention of the bacon flight. The flight sampler was a very nice addition to try and I recommend it if you are a bacon freak! The jalapeno bacon had a nice little punch and was extremely tasty. I ordered the single waffle with strawberries and whip cream. The waffle was good the syrup was thick and old fashioned. I also tried a few pieces of French toast, The toast however was not crunchy even though we asked the waiter to make sure it was. The overall experience was good and I probably would revisit this location again in the future.

HQsXkwZjSSJWPsv_vHSL2Q.text: Alright, usually I am pretty nice. But this place. Is costly for a small amount of food. I would be ok if I spent $11 on a plate of food I couldn't finish and organic or something special. We got the Flight of Bacon of course- $12 for 8 slices btw. Not bad tasting bacon either. So that was a plus, I got the French toast combo- small serving on a big plate. Hubs got the Pancake combo- 2 big pancakes 2 patties and 1 egg (really)..   Me personally I would not come back. Overpriced and subpar food. The coffee was ok though.

Gj1X9NG2PHKig0eCD13Jhw.text: Bacon. You will never go wrong with the bacon.  I pass by The Oink Cafe often, and I decided to come here with a friend to enjoy a Saturday morning brunch. I love the fact that they embrace the entire breakfast pig theme! Inside, the walls are decorated with artistic pieces of adorable pigs, and a wall full of kid's coloring of "Bacon the Pig". I'd say it's worth spending some time looking at this wall. Some of the colorings are pretty hilarious.   I got the traditional breakfast of two eggs plus bacon, because you got to try their bacon. Their bacon ranges from the traditional applewood to more interesting flavors such as honey curd or apple cider. Overall, the food was alright. What really sells this place is the atmosphere and service you get here! I will definitely come back to try some more bacon!

JTqD0Ry27awWaCyZafDKlQ.text: My friend, who's still in the dating scene, complained in the manner of a question - what's with women and brunch?  "Hey, I happen to like brunch!" I retorted.  I either work through the night on Friday evenings, and have Saturday morning brunch with my wife, when I get home. Or I get up late on Saturdays, and have brunch with her and/or my daughters.  Either way, it's about as close as I will ever get to eating breakfast; which rarely happens.  We had driven past this place several times in the past, and always wondered what their bacon was like. If you have't already figured out the "oink" inference, their specialty is their varied assortment of bacon strips.  Yes, it's a breakfast / lunch / brunch joint, with a specific specialization!  We journeyed to this place more out of curiosity,  as there are a myriad of breakfast places along the way.   it didn't take long for us to get seated even though the place was bustling. Speaking of bustling, you'll immediately notice the above average noise levels with all those patrons conversing about.  I ordered the Veggie Omelette, with pancakes, along with a side of bacon. My wife ordered the French toast with a side of bacon. For good measure, we also ordered another side of bacon. We tried various kinds, but the honey bacon was our favorite. It's probably because of our sweet tooth.   All their bacons were light, crispy and absolutely delicious. None were overdone, and not too greasy either. They definitely properly strained it so that it isn't laden with grease before it is served.  Our main courses were relegated to obscurity, as far as we were concerned. In spite of our tremendous lauding of the bacon, the omelette and the French toast were not very impressive. The pancake was quite flat and not fluffy at all inside. My pancake had the flat consistency of cardboard with every bite I took. It was definitely not my favorite.  All in all, it was a good experience. Although, except for the bacon, their other offerings were not that impressive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

dGwJ81NDp2yZqSXe3C0x0A.text: Love this place! I had the turkado Benedict and the wife had chorizo chimi and they were both AMAZING! We shared a side of bacon too. The service was great and decor quirky and pleasant!  Definitely coming back and bringing family!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Best Bennie in town!

VES9m0U78COROONSyjGPnw.text: Came here on a last minute quest for Bloody Marys and brunch. A beautiful chalkboard with food art really stands out when you come in. The place has a weird feel of country vs trendy vibe. I wish they would just commit to one or the other.   The Bloody Mary's did not disappoint, they were excellent and interesting in their flavors! Did the Oink, Verde, Maria, and Classic. Also did the Mimosa flight, all delicious. Bacon flight, so porking good!  Ambiance is casual, lots of families. Bar is there, but it's kind of small. It's mainly a cafe style set up, but there was a TV playing a soccer game in the middle of the Cafe and one at the bar. Service was good, but our server seemed a little overwhelmed and wound up. Maybe from the morning rush, since we were there later and it started dying down, but still waited 20 minutes to be seated.   Biscuits and gravy had too much batter, you could detect an aftertaste of flour. The Strawberry Cheesecake pancakes were yummy and gave us diabetes. Pork Benedict had great flavor on the pork, the egg was perfect, but I wish the muffin was better quality bread. Portion sizes are hearty.  Total bill was about $75 for three people and the 3 extras (Mimosa, bloody Mary, and bacon flight), so not too bad. I debated between 3 or 4 stars, but the lack of wow with the food entrees and the halfway trendy atmosphere gave me an uneasy feeling, like it didn't seem like a place to get Bloody Mary's and day drink, but it also didn't feel like a country breakfast cafe. 3.5 stars, I wouldn't mind going again just for the flights.

Photo of The Oink Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mimosa flight yasss

U1b2DxrCfip1cg0LeE8P-A.text: This place is the perfect stop for a delicious brunch, any place with bacon in the name is bound to have high expectations and The Oink Cafe did not disappoint! Perfectly crisp on the outside, as any chimichanga should be, and on the inside the most tender and crispy pork confit (that's fancy for carnitas), and if that is not enough to seduce any palate the whole thing was smothered in a sinfully rich chorizo cheese sauce... heaven!! The service was great, and the manager and his wife were the perfect hosts! We would move to Arizona just to be closer to this cafe! Until next time Oink Cafe, you will be in our food dreams!   -smiley

snN8vaVLm0rN-LBrUAEgsg.text: I love this breakfast place. Delicious Bloody Mary and definitely never a long line. Great service and food.

CV267HGmzgr39yWs7HQT0g.text: We have been anxious to try the Oink Cafe and it did not disappoint! The restaurant was quite busy, but our server was friendly and helpful. The Bacon Flight was delicious! So little pricey, yes. But it's fun, tasty and not something we would order every visit. The Bloody Mary Flight was also delicious, unique and all four drinks had quite a kick. We will definitely order this again!  The omelet was stuffed with ingredients and was tasty. The hashbrowns were cooked crispy and the chicken fried steak was, like everything else, cooked perfectly. Unlike some reviewers, I liked the design of the place...bright, upbeat and fun! As for the notice level, it is quite noisy...but not so loud that we couldn't have a conversation. We look forward to our next visit!
